question: The difference between a discount of 40% on 500 Rs. and two successive discounts of 36% and 4% on the same amount is :
explanation:
Single equivalent discount of two successive discounts of 36% and 4% 
$latex = 36+4-\\frac{36\\times 4}{100}&s=1$
= 40 - 1.44 = 38.56
Percentage difference = 40 - 38.56 = 1.44
âˆ´ Required Difference = 
$latex = 500\\times \\frac{1.44}{100} = 7.20 Rs.&s=1$
Hence option [A] is correct answer.
